required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Universal CAR-γδT Cell Injection in the Treatment of Patients With Relapsed AML After Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Universal CAR-γδT Cell Injection in the Treatment of Patients With Relapsed AML After Transplantation

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open single-arm clinical study aimed at evaluating the efficacy and safety of universal γδT cell injection in the treatment of patients with relapsed AML after transplantation

detailed_description.textblock:
Main purpose: To evaluate the safety and effectiveness of universal CAR-γδT cell injection in the treatment of patients with relapsed AML after transplantation
Secondary purpose: to investigate the in vivo dynamics characteristics of universal CAR-γδT cells after infusion and explore reasonable therapeutic doses through climbing tests in different dose groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety: Incidence and severity of adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: First 1 month post CAR-T cells infusion
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the possible adverse events occurred within first one month after CAR-γδT infusion, including the incidence and severity of symptoms such as cytokine release syndrome and neurotoxicity
Remission Rate including complete remission(CR)、CR with incomplete blood count recovery(CRi)、No remission(NR)

secondary_outcome.description: the copy number of CAR- γδT cells in the genomes of PBMC by qPCR method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: First 1 month post CAR-T cells infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Cytokine( IL-6,IL-10,IFN-γ,TNF-α ) concentration (pg/mL) by flow cytometry method

arm_group.description: Patients will be treated with CAR--γδT cells

intervention.description: Biological: CAR-γδT; Drug: Cyclophosphamide,Fludarabine; Procedure: Leukapheresis;
